definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
(of an actor) to disengage from the performance (e.g. after the show ends)/(of an audience) to lose interest in the performance
photo taken during a theatrical production/a still (from a movie)
ceremonial robe/formal attire (dinner suit, evening gown etc)
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to disguise oneself
(Chinese opera) to play a role outside of one's specialty/(modern) to play a transvestite role/to masquerade as an opponent
to appear on camera/to play a role in a film
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
